title: Reflecting on My First Web Dev Experience
summary: Join me on a nostalgic journey as I take a look back at my very first website creation, complete with all its amateur mistakes and valuable learning experiences.
content:
A Retrospective on Learning and Growth

Two years ago, I embarked on a journey to create my first website. As a beginner in the world of web development, I had no idea what I was getting myself into. But I was determined to learn and create something that I could be proud of.

The website I created was a replica of a franchised bubble tea shop's (Presotea) website. It had a simple layout with a navigation bar, special deals section, and a download section for the shop's mobile app.

Looking back at my first website, I can't help but feel a sense of nostalgia. I remember the excitement I felt when I finally got the navigation bar to work and how proud I was when I managed to make the special deals section toggle on and off.

Creating this website was a learning experience like no other. I had to familiarize myself with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript from scratch. I encountered many challenges along the way, but I persevered and found solutions through endless hours of research and experimentation.

My first website may not have been the most polished or sophisticated, but it holds a special place in my heart. It was the starting point of my journey as a web developer and a reminder of the innocent and eager learner I once was.

title: My First Website Using JavaScript
summary: A look back at the development of a website for a high school coding club.
content:
Leveling Up with JavaScript

Creating a website for my high school's coding club was a defining moment in my journey as a Web Developer. At the time, I just finished my first website - a replica of a bubble tea shop website.

codeToday was a highschool club that tutored students HTML and CSS. I didn't join codeToday but had a friend who did as a tutor. We shared an interest in web development and through a Discord call, came up with the idea to build a website for the club. We challenged each other to create our own designs for the website and to eventually merge our work together.

The result of that idea was the website you see before you. While it may not be the most user friendly or technologically advanced website, as a noob, it was a huge step forward for me in terms of my web development skills.

The parts of the website I designed and developed were the navbar, hero, and 'what we teach' sections. You could tell the hero was where I experimented with different design elements and tried to make the website stand out, though looking back, was quite unoriginal.

There were a lot of firsts with this project. I first implemented logic in a website via JavaScript, first implemented eventListeners, first used dom manipulation, first created mobile-responsive design, and first deployed a website. It was incredibly satisfying to see the website come to life with all the dynamic features.

Looking back at this website, I am thrilled with how far I have come as a Web Developer. But more than that, I am reminded of the nostalgia and sense of accomplishment I felt when I first saw our finished product. Building this website with my friend was a fun and challenging experience, and I am grateful for the opportunity to have worked on it.
